tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
tokens.translation: properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise

tokens.resolved_gloss: Abimelek, the name of two Philistine kings and of two Israelites

tokens.resolved_gloss: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

tokens.resolved_gloss: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
tokens.translation: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

tokens.resolved_gloss: a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)

tokens.resolved_gloss: a tower (from its size or height); by analogy, a rostrum; figuratively, a (pyramidal) bed of flowers
tokens.translation: a tower (from its size or height); by analogy, a rostrum; figuratively, a (pyramidal) bed of flowers
